MODULE.name: Barcode
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: is used to either navigate to a URL or call a javascript function when an attached card reader decodes data.
MODULE.MORE_HELP: Only the foreground RhoElements application is given access to the card reader hardware, when an application is sent to the background its state will be saved and it will automatically relinquish control of the card reader. When brought back to the foreground, an application previously using the card reader will have its previous configuration (eg. pinTimeout) reapplied to the card reader automatically.

PROPERTIES.DESC: object supports this properties bla bla bla :

PROPERTY.name: autoEnter
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, automatically appends the character code for 'enter' to the end of any barcodes scanned. This is most useful to submit forms following a scan. This property will only take effect if you have not specified a callback to the enable method.

PROPERTY.name: autoTab
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, automatically appends the tab character to the end of any barcodes scanned. This is most useful if you are populating a form. This property will only take effect if you have not specified a callback to the enable method.

PROPERTY.name: linearSecurityLevel
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Describes the linear security level used during decoding.

VALUE.DESC: Two times redundancy based on redundancy flags and code length.
Two times redundancy if short barcode or Codabar.
Two times redundancy for long barcodes, three times for short barcodes.
Two times redundancy for all barcodes.
Three times redundancy for all barcodes.

PROPERTY.name: scanTimeout
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Maximum time in milliseconds that laser scanners will emit a beam or imager scanners will enable the imager. A value of 0 indicates an infinite timeout. This parameter is compatibile with aimType:trigger, aimType:timedHold, aimType:timedRelease and aimType:pressAndRelease. Note that for regulatory reasons scanTimeout is not configurable on all laser/imager scanners.

PROPERTY.name: rasterMode
PROPERTY.DESC: Describes the type of vertical rastering to use.

VALUE.DESC: No vertical rastering
Vertical rastering is always full open. To adjust the rastering height use the rasterHeight property.
Vertical rastering mode is 'Smart'.
Vertical rastering mode is 'Cyclone'.

PROPERTY.name: rasterHeight
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Laser Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Vertical rastering height to use, as a percentage, when rasterMode:openAlways is applied. This value must be between 0 - 100.

PROPERTY.name: aimType
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Describes the type of aiming to use.

VALUE.DESC: Standard trigger mode. Holding the trigger will start a decoding session.
Aiming lasts for the time specified by 'timedAimDuration' before decoding. The decode will last until the barcode is decoded or scanTimeout occurs.

Aiming lasts until trigger is released. If the timedAimDuration has expired when the trigger is released then a decode session is started until a barcode is decoded or for the remaining time equal to the scanTimeout value.

Provided to support Kiosk devices. The scanner illuminates when movement is detected in the range of the scanner window. In order to use this mode the scanner must be initiated with a softscan using the scanner.start() method and again after each decode. The device must be equipped with a sensor to detect movement to use presentation mode.
Scan will continue after the trigger is released until scanTimeout occurs.

Once the trigger is pulled barcodes will continue to be scanned whilst the trigger is held, enabling rapid scanning, to be used in conjunction with sameSymbolTimeout and differentSymbolTimeout. This value is ignored if viewfinderMode is set to 'dynamicReticle'

PROPERTY.name: timedAimDuration
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Duration in milliseconds for aimType:timedHold and aimType:timedRelease

PROPERTY.name: sameSymbolTimeout
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: When the aimType:continuousRead property is applied this value defines the interval between which the same barcode can be decoded twice. The value is specified in milliseconds, use 0 to indicate no interval between successive reads. Use this value to prevent accidental duplicate scans.

PROPERTY.name: differentSymbolTimeout
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: When the aimType:continuousRead property is applied this value defines the interval between which different barcodes can be scanned. The value is specified in milliseconds, use 0 to indicate no interval between successive reads. Use this setting to allow time for the operator to reaim the device between successive scans.

PROPERTY.name: aimMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Describes the aiming mode to used.

VALUE.DESC: No Aiming (Can be overridden by picklistMode).
Laser barcode readers will show a dot for aiming.
Laser barcode readers will show a slab for aiming.
Imager barcode readers will show a reticle for aiming.

PROPERTY.name: picklistMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Imager / Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Allows the imager to decode only the barcode that is directly under the cross-hair / center of the reticle. This feature is most useful in applications where multiple barcodes may appear in the field of view during a decode session and only one of them is targeted for decode. When enabled picklistMode will override aimMode if no aiming is chosen and use aimMode:reticle. This mode will also interact with viewfinderMode, see the EMDK for C help file for more information. Enabling picklist mode may adversely affect overall decoding performance.

VALUE.DESC: Disables picklist mode so any barcode within the field of view can be decoded.
Enables picklist mode so that only the barcode under the projected reticle can be decoded. If the imager does not support a projected reticle then the behaviour is the same as softwareReticle.
Enables picklist mode so that only the barcode in the center of the image is decoded. This is most useful when used in conjunction with static and dynamic reticle viewfinder modes.

PROPERTY.name: viewfinderMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Configures the mode of the scanner viewfinder window. This attribute is not supported on all Scanners and will interact with the picklistMode parameter, see the EMDK for C help file for more information.

VALUE.DESC: Only the viewfinder is enabled (not the reticle). Displays a viewfinder on the screen showing the image being captured by the camera.
The viewfinder will not be displayed during aiming or scanning. Not supported on Android.
Displays the viewfinder as well as draws a red reticle in the center of the image which helps with tracking the barcode.

Displays the viewfinder as well as draws a red reticle in the center of the image. If the barcode in the image is 'decodable' the reticle turns green to indicate this. This mode requires a second trigger press to decode the barcode after the reticle turns green. Not supported on Android

PROPERTY.name: viewfinderX
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: When scanning a barcode using a Camera scanner the viewfinder preview window will appear this number of pixels from the left hand side of the screen. The images displayed in the viewfinder will be scaled as appropriate.

PROPERTY.name: viewfinderY
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: When scanning a barcode using a Camera scanner the viewfinder preview window will appear this number of pixels from the top of the screen. The images displayed in the viewfinder will be scaled as appropriate.

PROPERTY.name: viewfinderWidth
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: When scanning a barcode using a Camera scanner the viewfinder preview window will be this number of pixels wide. The images displayed in the viewfinder will be scaled as appropriate.

PROPERTY.name: viewfinderHeight
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: When scanning a barcode using a Camera scanner the viewfinder preview window will be this number of pixels high. The images displayed in the viewfinder will be scaled as appropriate.

PROPERTY.name: viewfinderFeedback
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Configures the feedback given after a successful scan in milliseconds. This value is ignored if aimType is set to continuousRead and no feedback will be given.

VALUE.DESC: The last image that was successfully decoded is displayed. The time for which the image is displayed can be configured by the viewfinderFeedbackTime parameter.
No feedback is given in the viewfinder after a successful decode.

The last image that was successfully decoded is displayed along with a red reticle in the center of the image. The time for which the image is displayed can be configured by the viewfinderFeedbackTime parameter.

PROPERTY.name: viewfinderFeedbackTime
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: If the viewfinderFeedback:enabled or viewfinderFeedback:reticle are applied then the decoded barcode will remain on the screen for this duration. Specified in milliseconds.

PROPERTY.name: focusMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Imager / Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the focus mode in use.

VALUE.DESC: Use fixed focus.
Use auto focus.

PROPERTY.name: illuminationMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Imager / Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Selects the illumination mode to use.

VALUE.DESC: Auto-exposure algorithms will decide whether illumination is required or not. Not available on Android.
External illumination is always on.
External illumination is always off.

PROPERTY.name: dpmMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Imager / Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Allows Direct Part Marking (DPM) barcodes to be read when true but may adversely affect overall decoding performance. DPM is a way of stamping barcodes directly on physical objects and is only available on DPM terminals.

PROPERTY.name: inverse1dMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices. The scanning engine must support inverse barcodes
PROPERTY.DESC: Allows the user to select inverse 1D barcodes for decoding.

VALUE.DESC: Auto-exposure algorithms will decide whether illumination is required or not. Not available on Android.
External illumination is always on.
External illumination is always off.

PROPERTY.name: poorQuality1dMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Imager / Camera Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Allows poor quality 1D barcodes to be read when true but this will adversely affect the overall decoding performance.

PROPERTY.name: beamWidth
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Laser Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the width of the laser beam. All devices will support normal beam widths but other widths may not be supported on your device.

VALUE.DESC: Laser beam width is normal
Laser beam width is wide.
Laser beam width is narrow.

PROPERTY.name: dbpMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Laser Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Describes the type of Digital Bar Pulse (DBP) being produced by the scan engine.

VALUE.DESC: Tells the scan engine to produce normal DBP.

Tells the scan engine to produce composite DBP, which is 2 different sets of DBP data multiplexed together for better decode performance. In order to enable this mode it must be supported by the scanner.

PROPERTY.name: klasseEins
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Laser Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the Klasse Eins laser on time function.

PROPERTY.name: adaptiveScanning
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Laser Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables adaptive scanning. When set to true, the scan engine will automatically toggle between 2 scan angles, wide and narrow, allowing the scan engine to decode barcodes both in close proximity and far away (~100 inches). Adaptive scanning is only supported in high performance, long working range scan engines such as SE960

PROPERTY.name: bidirectionalRedundancy
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Laser Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables bidirectional redundancy.

PROPERTY.name: barcodeDataFormat
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Camera / Imager Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the format in which the barcode data is returned, binary data is returned in Data URI format with the appropriate mime type. This parameter is designed to be used primarily with image based symbologies (eg. Signature). Binary data will not be output as keystrokes, you must set a decode callback in order to receive scanned data.

VALUE.DESC: Scanned data will be returned in Data URI format
Scanned data will be returned in Text format

PROPERTY.name: dataBufferSize
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the number of bytes allocated to receive the scanned barcode. This parameter is designed to be used primarily with image based symbologies and should not be modified unless absolutely necessary (eg. Signature).

PROPERTY.name: connectionIdleTimeout
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Bluetooth Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the time, in seconds, that an external scanner will be allowed to remain idle before the connection is terminated to conserve power.

PROPERTY.name: disconnectBtOnDisable
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Bluetooth Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Forces the scanner to disconnect from the terminal when it is 'disabled'. Since the scanner is disabled when you navigate to a new page, set this value to false if you want to maintain the bluetooth connection to your remote scanner.

PROPERTY.name: displayBtAddressBarcodeOnEnable
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Bluetooth Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: If set to true the bluetooth address will be displayed as a barcode on the screen during the pairing process, initiated by calling 'enable' on a bluetooth scanner. Not all devices support this functionality. Note you must specify this parameter before or within the call to 'enable'.

PROPERTY.name: enableTimeout
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Bluetooth Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Configures the time (in seconds) allowed to pair with the external bluetooth scanner after calling the 'enable()' method. You must specify this parameter before calling 'enable' to change the default.

PROPERTY.name: friendlyName
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns the friendly name associated with the scanner

PROPERTY.name: lowBatteryScan
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Set to false to disable scanning when the battery is low or set to true to enable it. Once disabled the scanner can be enabled again by calling enable().

PROPERTY.name: disableScannerDuringNavigate
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: By default if you have enabled the Scanner on a page, through either JavaScript or Ruby and navigate to a new page the Scanner will automatically disable. To override this behaviour you can set this option to false and once enabled the Scanner will remain so in the foreground application ultil you disable it.

PROPERTY.name: decodeVolume
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: The volume of the device beeper when a barcode is scanned. 0 to 5 with 5 being the loudest.

PROPERTY.name: decodeDuration
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: The duration of the device beeper when a barcode is scanned, in milliseconds.

PROPERTY.name: decodeFrequency
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: The frequency of the device beeper when a barcode is successfully decoded. This should be within the range of the beeper but the API will accept values in the range 0 to 65535.

PROPERTY.name: invalidDecodeFrequency
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: The frequency of the device beeper when a barcode is scanned but not successfully decoded. This should be within the range of the beeper but the API will accept values in the range 0 to 65535. Not applicable to Android.

PROPERTY.name: decodeSound
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Local path to a wave file to be played when the scanner successfully decodes a barcode. This setting overrides the scanner beeper. Not available on Android.

PROPERTY.name: invalidDecodeSound
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Local path to a wave file to be played when a barcode is scanned but not successfully decoded. This setting overrides the scanner beeper. Not available on Android.

PROPERTY.name: allDecoders
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Scanners on Motorola Solutions' devices
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the barcode scanner to read all barcode types that the scanner is capable of reading. Note that some decoders will not be enabled as some symbologies use the same systems to encode data, making it impossible to differentiate between them. For example: "canpostal" and "auspostal" both use a 4-state system, so devices will only enable either "canpostal" OR "auspostal" when "alldecoders" is enabled. Note that other symbologies also share the 4-state system.

PROPERTY.name: aztec
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Aztec barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: chinese2of5
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Chinese 2of5 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: codabar
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Codabar barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: codabarClsiEditing
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables Codabar CLSi formatting when set to true.

PROPERTY.name: codabarMaxLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the maximum number of allowable characters in a Codabar barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: codabarMinLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the minimum number of allowable characters in a Codabar barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: codabarNotisEditing
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables Codabar NotisEditing formatting when set to true.

PROPERTY.name: codabarRedundancy
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the Codabar Redundancy property, if set the barcode must be decoded twice before being accepted. This will slow scanning but improve reliability.

PROPERTY.name: code11
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Code11 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: code11checkDigitCount
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies whether to verify 0, 1 or 2 check digits.

VALUE.DESC: Scanning engine will verify no Code 11 check digits
Scanning engine will verify one Code 11 check digit
Scanning engine will verify two Code 11 check digits

PROPERTY.name: code11maxLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the maximum number of allowable characters in a Code 11 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: code11minLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the minimum number of allowable characters in a Code 11 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: code11redundancy
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the Code 11 Redundancy property, if set the barcode must be decoded twice before being accepted. This will slow scanning but improve reliability.

PROPERTY.name: code11reportCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true the barcode check digit(s) will be reported for scanned Code 11 barcodes

PROPERTY.name: code128
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Code128 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: code128checkIsBtTable
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, decodes concatenated Code128 output only if the pair belongs to one of the commonly concatenated pairs as defined by the standard.

PROPERTY.name: code128ean128
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, barcodes with the EAN128 subtype property set will be read.

PROPERTY.name: code128isbt128
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, barcodes with the isbt128 subtype property set will be read.

PROPERTY.name: code128isbtConcatMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the Code128 ISBT concatenation mode property. This feature allows a pair of barcodes which meet certain criteria defined in teh ISBT128 spec to be reported as a single barcode. This paramter describes the different concatenation modes available for ISBT128

VALUE.DESC: Will ignore the barcode pair and only output decode data for one of the barcodes
Will not decode if both barcodes are not present or if one of them can not be decoded
Auto-Discriminate

PROPERTY.name: code128maxLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the maximum number of allowable characters in a Code 128 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: code128minLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the minimum number of allowable characters in a Code 128 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: code128other128
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the other 128 property which enables the non EAN and non ISBT 128 subtype.

PROPERTY.name: code128redundancy
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the Code 128 Redundancy property, if set the barcode must be decoded twice before being accepted. This will slow scanning but improve reliability.

PROPERTY.name: code128securityLevel
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the Code 128 security level and accepts a value between 0 and 3 inclusive. 0: Allows the scanner to operate in its most aggressive state, while providing sufficient security in decoding most 'in-spec' barcodes. 1: Eliminates most mis-decodes. 2: Select this option if security level 1 fails to eliminate mis-decodes. 3: Select this option if security level 1 and 2 fail to eliminate mis-decodes. Be advised that selecting level 3 is an extreme measure against mis-decoding and will significantly impair the decoding ability of the scanner.

PROPERTY.name: compositeAb
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Composite AB barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: compositeAbUccLinkMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Describes whether UCC link mode is enabled

VALUE.DESC: Link flag is ignored
Composite AB barcodes are always linked
Auto-discriminate whether Composite AB barcodes are linked

PROPERTY.name: compositeAbUseUpcPreambleCheckDigitRules
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: This setting causes the UPC rules specified in teh UPC EAN parameters to be used when reporting composite decode data.

PROPERTY.name: compositeC
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Composite C barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: code39
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Code 39 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: code39code32Prefix
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables reporting of the Code32 prefix when a Code39 barcode is converted.

PROPERTY.name: code39convertToCode32
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables conversion from Code39 to Code 32 barcodes, when set the decoded barcode is converted to Code 32.

PROPERTY.name: code39fullAscii
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables full ASCII conversion of Code 39 barcodes

PROPERTY.name: code39maxLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the maximum number of allowable characters in a Code 39 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: code39minLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the minimum number of allowable characters in a Code 39 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: code39redundancy
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the Code 39 Redundancy property, if set the barcode must be decoded twice before being accepted. This will slow scanning but improve reliability.

PROPERTY.name: code39reportCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables reporting of the Code 39 check digit when a Code 39 barcode is scanned.

PROPERTY.name: code39securityLevel
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the Code 128 security level and accepts a value between 0 and 3 inclusive. 0: This setting allows the scanner to operate in its most aggressive state, while providing sufficient security in decoding most 'in-spec' barcodes. 1: This setting eliminates most mis-decodes. 2: Select this option if security level 1 fails to eliminate mis-decodes. 3: Select this option if security level 1 and 2 fail to eliminate mis-decodes. Be advised that selecting level 3 is an extreme measure against mis-decoding and will significantly impair the decoding ability of the scanner.

PROPERTY.name: code39verifyCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Turns on verification of the Code 39 check digit.

PROPERTY.name: code93
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Code 93 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: code93maxLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the maximum number of allowable characters in a Code 93 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: code93minLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the minimum number of allowable characters in a Code 93 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: code93redundancy
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the Code 93 Redundancy property, if set the barcode must be decoded twice before being accepted. This will slow scanning but improve reliability.

PROPERTY.name: d2of5
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for D2of5 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: d2of5maxLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the maximum number of allowable characters in a D2of5 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: d2of5minLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the minimum number of allowable characters in a D2of5 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: d2of5redundancy
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the D2of5 Redundancy property, if set the barcode must be decoded twice before being accepted. This will slow scanning but improve reliability.

PROPERTY.name: datamatrix
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Datamatrix barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: ean8
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for EAN 8 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: ean8convertToEan13
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, EAN 8 barcodes will be converted to EAN 13 and EAN 13 parameters used.

PROPERTY.name: i2of5
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for I2of5 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: i2of5convertToEan13
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, EAN 8 barcodes will be converted to EAN 13 and EAN 13 parameters used.

PROPERTY.name: i2of5maxLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the maximum number of allowable characters in a I2of5 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: i2of5minLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the minimum number of allowable characters in a I2of5 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: i2of5redundancy
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the I2of5 Redundancy property, if set the barcode must be decoded twice before being accepted. This will slow scanning but improve reliability.

PROPERTY.name: i2of5reportCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true the barcode check digit(s) will be reported for scanned I2of5 barcodes.

PROPERTY.name: i2of5verifyCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables the verification of the I2of5 check digit

VALUE.DESC: Disables verification of the check digit.
Enables the USS format for the check digit.
Enables the OPCC format for the check digit.

PROPERTY.name: korean3of5
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Korean 3of5 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: korean3of5redundancy
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets Korean 3of5 Redundancy property, if set the barcode must be decoded twice before being accepted. This will slow scanning but improve reliability.

PROPERTY.name: korean3of5maxLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the maximum number of allowable characters in a Korean 3of5 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: korean3of5minLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the minimum number of allowable characters in a Korean 3of5 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: macroPdf
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Macro PDF barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: macroPdfBufferLabels
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, the scanner driver will return he barcode data only after the complete macroPdf sequence has been read. If false, the scan driver will return each barcode in the macroPdf sequence as it is read.

PROPERTY.name: macroPdfConvertToPdf417
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: If true, MacroPDF barcodes will be converted to PDF417 codes.

PROPERTY.name: macroPdfExclusive
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: If true, the scanner driver will not complete read requests while in the middle of a macroPdf sequence. Once a macroPdf sequence has been started it must be completed or cancelled before the scan driver will complete other read requests.

PROPERTY.name: macroMicroPdf
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Macro Micro PDF barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: macroMicroPdfBufferLabels
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: If true, the scanner driver will return the barcode data only after the complete macroMicroPdf sequence has been read. If false, the scanner driver will return each barcode in the macroMicroPdf sequence as it is read.

PROPERTY.name: macroMicroPdfConvertToMicroPdf
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: If true, MacroMicroPDF barcodes will be converted to MicroPDF codes.

PROPERTY.name: macroMicroPdfExclusive
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: If true, the scanner driver will not complete read requests while in the middle of a macroMicroPdf sequence. Once a macroMicroPdf sequence has been started it must be completed or cancelled before the scan driver will complete other read requests.

PROPERTY.name: macroMicroPdfReportAppendedInfo
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: If true, the appended info is concatenated to the decoded data before being returned.

PROPERTY.name: matrix2of5
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Matrix 2of5 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: matrix2of5maxLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the maximum number of allowable characters in a Matrix 2of5 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: matrix2of5minLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the minimum number of allowable characters in a Matrix 2of5 barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: matrix2of5reportCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true the barcode check digit(s) will be reported for scanned Matrix 2of5 barcodes.

PROPERTY.name: matrix2of5verifyCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables verification of the Matrix 2of5 symbology check digit.

PROPERTY.name: maxiCode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Maxicode barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: microPdf
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Micro PDF barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: microQr
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Micro QR barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: msi
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for MSI barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: msiCheckDigits
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the number of MSI check digits to use

VALUE.DESC: Use one check digit for MSI barcodes.
Use two check digits for MSI barcodes.

PROPERTY.name: msiCheckDigitScheme
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the check digit scheme used to verify MSI barcodes

VALUE.DESC: The first check digit is MOD 11, the second is MOD 10.
Both check digits are MOD 10.

PROPERTY.name: msiMaxLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the maximum number of allowable characters in a MSI barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: msiMinLength
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the minimum number of allowable characters in a MSI barcode. If your application only expects barcode lengths in a certain range, reducing the allowed range can improve scanning performance. Allowed values are 0 to 55

PROPERTY.name: msiRedundancy
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the MSI Redundancy property, if set the barcode must be decoded twice before being accepted. This will slow scanning but improve reliability.

PROPERTY.name: msiReportCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true the barcode check digit(s) will be reported for scanned MSI barcodes.

PROPERTY.name: pdf417
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for PDF 417 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Australian Postal barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: canPostal
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Canadian Postal barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: dutchPostal
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Dutch Postal barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: japPostal
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Japanese Postal barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: ukPostal
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for UK Postal barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: ukPostalReportCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true the barcode check digit(s) will be reported for scanned UK Postal barcodes.

PROPERTY.name: us4State
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for US 4-State barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: us4StateFics
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for US 4-State FICS barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: usPlanet
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for US Planet barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: usPlanetReportCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true the barcode check digit(s) will be reported for scanned US Planet barcodes.

PROPERTY.name: usPostNet
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for US Post Net barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: usPostNetReportCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true the barcode check digit(s) will be reported for scanned US Post Net barcodes

PROPERTY.name: qrCode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for QR Code barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: gs1dataBar
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for GS1 DataBar barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance. This symbology was previously known as rss.

PROPERTY.name: gs1dataBarExpanded
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for GS1 Databar Expanded barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance. This symbology was previously known as rssExp.

PROPERTY.name: gs1dataBarLimited
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for GS1 Databar Limited barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance. This symbology was previously known as rssLim.

PROPERTY.name: tlc39
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for TLC 39 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: upcEanBookland
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables decoding of UPC EAN Bookland barcodes.

PROPERTY.name: upcEanBooklandFormat
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the bookland format to use when decoding UPC EAN Bookland barcodes

VALUE.DESC: Causes 978 bookland barcodes to be reported in 10 digit mode.
Causes 978/979 bookland barcodes to be transmitted as EAN13 as per 2007 ISBN-13 protocol.

PROPERTY.name: upcEanConvertGs1dataBarToUpcEan
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: If true, RSS barcodes will be converted to UPC/EAN format. For this setting to work UPC/EAN symbologies must be enabled.

PROPERTY.name: upcEanCoupon
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables decoding of UPC EAN Coupon barcodes

PROPERTY.name: upcEanLinearDecode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the linear decode property.

PROPERTY.name: upcEanRandomWeightCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, enables random weight check digit verification.

PROPERTY.name: upcEanRetryCount
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the retry count for auto-discriminating for supplementals. The value must be between 2 - 20 inclusive.

PROPERTY.name: upcEanSecurityLevel
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the Security level for decoding UPC EAN barcodes and accepts a value between 0 and 3 inclusive. 0: This setting allows the scanner to operate in its most aggressive state, while providing sufficient security in decoding most 'in-spec' barcodes. 1: This setting eliminates most mis-decodes. 2: Select this option if security level 1 fails to eliminate mis-decodes. 3: Select this option if security level 1 and 2 fail to eliminate mis-decodes. Be advised that selecting level 3 is an extreme measure against mis-decoding and will significantly impair the decoding ability of the scanner.

PROPERTY.name: upcEanSupplemental2
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, enables the supplemental barcode decoding. Note you must have upcEanSupplementalMode:always set for this parameter to take effect

PROPERTY.name: upcEanSupplemental5
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, enables the supplemental barcode decoding. Note you must have upcEanSupplementalMode:always set for this parameter to take effect.

PROPERTY.name: upcEanSupplementalMode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Describes the UPC EAN Supplemental mode.

VALUE.DESC: Supplementals are ignored.
Auto-discriminates supplementals.
Will not decode upc/ean without supplementals

The decoder will return the decoded value of the main block right away if it does not belong to any of the supplemental types. If the barcode starts with one of the prefixes it will search the image more aggressively for a supplemental. The scanner will try to scan the supplemental if it is present but if that fails, the main barcode will be returned.

Auto-discriminates supplemental for upc/ean codes starting with 378 or 379. Will disable reading of supplementals for any other upc/ean barcodes not starting with these values. The supplemental will be scanned if present but if scanning fails then the main barcode will be returned.

Auto-discriminates supplemental for upc/ean codes starting with 978 or 979. Will disable reading of supplementals for any other upc/ean barcodes not starting with these values. The supplemental will be scanned if present but if scanning fails then the main barcode will be returned.

Auto-discriminates supplemental for upc/ean codes starting with 414 or 419 or 434 or 439. Will disable reading of supplementals for any other upc/ean barcodes not starting with these values. The supplemental will be scanned if present but if scanning fails then the main barcode will be returned.

PROPERTY.name: upca
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for UPCA barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: upcaPreamble
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Controls the preamble applied to the UPCA barcode.

VALUE.DESC: Applies no preamble to the bar code.
Applies system character preamble to the bar code.
Applies both system and country code preamble to the bar code

PROPERTY.name: upcaReportCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true the barcode check digit(s) will be reported for scanned UPCA barcodes

PROPERTY.name: upce0
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for UPCE0 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: upce0convertToUpca
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, scanned UPCE0 barcodes will be converted to UPCA and UPCA parameters used.

PROPERTY.name: upce0preamble
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Controls the preamble applied to the UPCE0 barcode.

VALUE.DESC: Applies no preamble to the bar code.
Applies system character preamble to the bar code.
Applies both system and country code preamble to the bar code

PROPERTY.name: upce0reportCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true the barcode check digit(s) will be reported for scanned UPCE0 barcodes.

PROPERTY.name: upce1
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for UPCE1 barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: upce1convertToUpca
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true, scanned UPCE1 barcodes will be converted to UPCA and UPCA parameters used.

PROPERTY.name: upce1preamble
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Controls the preamble applied to the UPCE1 barcode.

VALUE.DESC: Applies no preamble to the bar code.
Applies system character preamble to the bar code.
Applies both system and country code preamble to the bar code

PROPERTY.name: upce1reportCheckDigit
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: When true the barcode check digit(s) will be reported for scanned UPCE1 barcodes.

PROPERTY.name: webcode
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: Enables or disables the symbology for Webcode barcodes. If your application does not expect to scan this symbology you should disable it to improve scanning performance.

PROPERTY.name: webcodeDecodeGtSubtype
PROPERTY.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties
PROPERTY.DESC: If true, the GT Webcode subtype will be decoded

METHOD.name: enable
METHOD.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties

PARAM.name: propertyMap
PARAM.DESC: Map of properties I want to set

METHOD.name: registerBluetoothStatus
METHOD.APPLIES: Not all scanning engines support all symbologies or all symbology properties

PARAM.name: propertyMap
PARAM.DESC: Map of properties I want to set
